topic.name: Biblical Geography & Cultural Context
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Biblical Geography & Cultural Context in Geography

objectives.objective_text: Identify the Jordan River.
Name the 12 Tribes who got land.
Identify the Philistine plain.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Identify Eden as the first garden home.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Name the Tigris and Euphrates rivers.
Identify the Red Sea.
Name the desert where they walked.
Identify Abraham's long trip.
Name Canaan as the Promised Land.
Identify Bethlehem, Nazareth, and Jerusalem.
Name the Sea of Galilee (where Jesus walked on water).
Identify a boat used for travel.
Name Paul as the missionary traveler.
Recall that the land had milk and honey.
Observe a map with different colored tribes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Recall that the first people lived near these rivers.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Observe maps showing where Eden might have been.
Recall Mount Sinai as the big mountain.
Observe that deserts are hot and dry.
Recall that they lived in tents and moved around.
Observe the route from Ur to Haran to Canaan.
Recall that Jesus walked everywhere.
Observe the Jordan River where Jesus was baptized.
Recall that the Good News went to the whole world.
Observe lines on a map showing Paul's trips.
Summarize the division of the land among the 12 tribes.
Explain the strategic value of Jericho.
Explain the Transjordan tribes (Reuben, Gad, Manasseh).
Defend the geographical logic of Solomon's fortified cities.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the geography of the Fertile Crescent.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Explain why civilization started between two rivers (Mesopotamia).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Locate modern-day Iraq as the setting for early Genesis.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Explain the environmental conditions that supported early civilization.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Defend the historicity of biblical locations using archaeological data.
Summarize the geography of the Sinai Peninsula.
Explain the miracle of the Red Sea crossing.
Trace the possible route on a map.
Explain the debate over the location of Mt. Sinai (Traditional vs. Arabia).
Defend the historicity of the wilderness wanderings.
Summarize the route of the Patriarchs along the Fertile Crescent.
Explain why they went to Egypt during famines (Nile reliability).
Locate Hebron, Bethel, and Shechem.
Explain the strategic value of the Negev.
Defend the geographical accuracy of the travel narratives in Genesis.
Summarize the three main regions: Galilee, Samaria, Judea.
Explain why Jews avoided Samaria.
Locate the Mount of Olives.
Explain the political geography of Herod's kingdom.
Defend the geographical accuracy of the Gospels (e.g., John's details).
Summarize Paul's three missionary journeys.
Explain how Roman Roads helped spread the Gospel.
Locate Rome, Athens, and Antioch.
Explain the geography of the Seven Churches of Revelation.
Defend the historical reliability of Acts based on geographical details.
Compare the geography of the Northern Kingdom (Israel) and Southern Kingdom (Judah).
Analyze the defensive advantages of Jerusalem's topography (valleys).
Interpret the phrase 'from Dan to Beersheba'.
Connect the tribal allotments to the physical landscape.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Compare the garden of Eden with the Tower of Babel location.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the strategic importance of the Fertile Crescent for trade and war.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the geographical plausibility of the Flood narrative.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Connect Abraham's journey from Ur to the geography of the region.
Compare the fertile Nile Delta (Goshen) with the Wilderness.
Analyze the logistics of moving a nation through a desert biome.
Interpret the location of Kadesh Barnea.
Connect the topography of Sinai to the giving of the Law.
Compare the hill country (safety) with the plains (war).
Analyze the importance of water wells in the patriarchal narratives.
Interpret the 'Via Maris' (Way of the Sea) trade route.
Connect the topography of Canaan to the nomadic lifestyle.
Compare the rural Galilee with the urban Jerusalem.
Analyze the elevation change from Jerusalem down to Jericho.
Interpret the fishing economy of the Sea of Galilee.
Connect the Decapolis (Gentile region) to Jesus' ministry.
Compare travel by land vs. travel by sea in Acts.
Analyze the shipwreck narrative in Acts 27 (nautical geography).
Interpret the strategic choice of cities (Ephesus, Corinth, Philippi).
Connect the spread of the church to trade routes.
Evaluate the impact of topography on the Divided Monarchy's stability.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the relationship between river flooding patterns and theological worldviews.
Evaluate the environmental challenges (water/food) resolved by providence.
Evaluate the agricultural limitations of the Judean hill country.
Evaluate the strategic location of Caesarea Maritima.
Evaluate the physical barriers to the Gospel's spread.
Construct a strategic analysis of the Conquest campaigns.
Synthesize the relationship between covenant faithfulness and land retention.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Construct a geographical profile of Sumer and Akkad.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Eden, Mesopotamia & the Cradle of Civilization
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the physical geography of Mesopotamia with the biblical narrative.
Construct a comparative analysis of the Northern vs. Southern route theories.
Synthesize the typology of the 'Wilderness' in Scripture.
Construct a map of the geopolitical powers surrounding Canaan in the Bronze Age.
Synthesize the covenant promises with the physical land.
Construct a profile of 1st-Century Judean geography.
Synthesize the physical setting of the Passion Week.
Construct a map of the Pauline mission field.
Synthesize the role of the Pax Romana infrastructure in evangelism.
